revised_title: Disorder in Nematic Liquid Crystals and Nuclear Magnetic Relaxation
tldr: This article presents a continuum theory of disorder in nematic liquid crystals, focusing on nuclear magnetic relaxation. The author criticizes previous attempts to calculate the frequency-dependent term and offers an alternative calculation based on the continuum model developed in earlier papers. The theory explains the anomalous longitudinal relaxation time in nematic liquid crystals and provides a formula for the rotating-frame relaxation rate.
